teaser: The United Nations General Assembly meets in New York this week -- a look at its Millennium Development Goals. China will open the country's first 'free trade zone' in the city of Shanghai, where foreign companies will be able to sell products without the burden of import duties or taxes. And the long-term impact of the floods in Colorado.
description: The United Nations General Assembly meets in New York this week -- a look at its Millennium Development Goals. China will open the country's first 'free trade zone' in the city of Shanghai, where foreign companies will be able to sell products without the burden of import duties or taxes. And the long-term impact of the floods in Colorado.
title: Marketplace Morning Report for Tuesday, September 24, 2013
byline: Stacey Vanek Smith, David Weinberg, Bruce Johnson, Jonathan Zittrain, Rachel Dornhelm, David Brancaccio, Rob Schmitz and Janell Burley Hofmann
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Tuesday, September 24, 2013
